result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Email from Mary Jacques to Atty OSullivan

3:04 p.m.  Defendant Steven Mark Rinker in court with attorney Alex Stormont.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court addresses O'Sullivan regarding additional payments made.  2016 payments are made in full.  Total paid at this time is $9,300.00.  Court addresses Attorney Stormont.  Defendant is in technical default on the agreement.  Stormont addresses the Court regarding good faith efforts having been made.  Court addresses O'Sullivan regarding his request.  O'Sullivan is requesting revocation of the agreement.  Pletcher addresses the court regarding victim's wishes.  Pletcher has an e-mail from the victim.  Court reviews e-mail, makes e-mail part of the record.  Pletcher addresses the court regarding victim's wishes for consistent payments.  Stormont addresses the Court regarding payment history and financial situation.  Stormont - defendant does intend to make payments.  Court - $14,800 left to be paid in 2017 - would be $1850.00 per month.  Rinker addresses the Court regarding potential payments.  O'Sullivan addresses the Court regarding ability to stay current on payments and thinks revocation is appropriate. Court addresses the parties regarding a potential solution.  O'Sullivan would work with parties to make an amendment to the Deferred Agreement.  Off the record at 3:28 p.m. Back on the record at 3:36 p.m.  O'Sullivan addresses the Court regarding stipulated agreement.  Revoke agreement today, stay the pending future payments, Rinker would be given until July 1, 2017 to pay $2800, until October 1, 2017 to pay $8000 by October 1, 2017  and $4,000 by December 31, 2017.  Court find there are grounds for revoking Deferred Prosecution Agreement, stay revocation contingent upon making payments as follows, $2800 by July 1, 2017, $8,000 by October 1, 2017, $4,000.00 by December 31, 2017.  Quarterly payments in the amount of $4,000 to continue.  O'Sullivan to prepare order.  3:43 p.m.
Motion hearing on April 24, 2017 at 03:00 pm.
Motion hearing on April 13, 2017 at 04:00 pm.

1:17 Defendant Steven Mark Rinker in court with attorney John M. O'Boyle.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Stipulation by counsel of submission of checks and summary.  Exh#1,2,3; off/rec. Pamela Deal swn, ex by OSullivan.  Exh#1-checks written to Central Mortgage. Exh#2-checks written to Steven Rinker. Exh#3-HUD settlement statement.  Exh#4-mortgage statement; off/rec. 1:27 court recesses. 1:34 Court resumes. Nicholas Kurimay swn, ex by Atty OBoyle. Exh#5-police report from RFPD; off. OSullivan x ex. William Sormak swn, ex by OBoyle. OSullivan x ex. Court questions Mr. Sormak. OBoyle redirect. Steven Tipp swn, ex by OBoyle. OSullivan x ex. OBoyle redirect. Darrell Delahousaye swn, ex by OBoyle. OSullivan x ex. Exh#6-photos of loft area; off/rec.  OBoyle redirect. OSullivan x ex. Court questions witness. Sonia Hernendez swn, ex by OBoyle. OSullivan x ex.  OBoyle redirect. 2:35 Court recesses.  2:40 Court resumes. Steven Rinker swn, ex by OBoyle. Exh A-veterinary bills. Exh B-tax accountant Exh C-discussions with neighbors. Exh D & E -RJ Excavating bill. OSullivan x ex. Exh#7-Note for Loan; off/rec. Exh#8-Westconsin Credit Union Statement; off/rec.  OBoyle redirect. Exh F-copy of original note; off/rec. OBoyle off's Exh A-E. Court rec's. Exh#7- Note for Loan; off/rec. Exh#8- Exh G-off/rec.  OSullivan: $117,000 received from mortgage; sum of the checks of Exh#2. Court comes up with $125,000 when adding up checks in Exh#2. Rory: disability payments were being received by Mr Jacques along with the mortgage proceeds. Court: expenses paid on behalf of Mr Jacques. OSullivan: $7800 for check being reversed. lists amounts in Exh#7.  Court: 4.875% interest rate. OSullivan: mortgage was $68873.37 at 5% was what Mr Jacques had owing. $109,000 was borrowed from HUD; embezzled funds argument. Court: no evidence he claimed payments. OBoyle agrees and gives his argument. Notes face of Power of Attorney. Exh A = $2015. Written amounts was an estimate. OSullivan states Exh#2 =$123,756. Court: is there verbal or written approval? OBoyle: no evidence the remodeling was done with lack of consent of Mr Jacques. OBoyle gives argument. Exh G- CapWest Mortgage letter; off/rec.  Court: counsel to give the court a list of what they believe is the amount for restitution owed. The submissions due December 4. Court will issue a written decision or give an oral decision.

9:16  This also includes 14CF99  Defendant Steven Mark Rinker in court with attorney John M. O'Boyle.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Plead to Ct 3 of 5-27 information in 14CF54.  Dism Cts 1, 2, 4, 5, 6 and 14CF99.  State is requesting a  Deferred judgment of conviction  with restitution. Plea questionnaire is filed with the court. Parties will agree on the mediator within 30 days and get a date scheduled for mediation. Court orders  ** No contact by Mr Rinker directly or indirectly except through counsel with William Jacques.   Court reviews what no contact means with the defendant.  This agreement is to be reviewed after 3 years. OBoyle is reserving the right to argue the ablility to pay. The court goes through the argeement with the defendant and counsel and amendments are made. The court reviews the charge and the max penalties with the defendant.    Constitutional rights explained to defendant    Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights DEF PLEADS GUILTY to Ct 3 of 14CF54.      Facts are correct  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA and the waiver of the rights, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS.  Court  withholds the  entry of the JOC and approves the  DPA.  Court dismisses the remaining counts and 14CF99

requesting trial be changed to 3 days filed by the State

9:06 pm   TO INCLUDE 14CF99
Defendant Steven Mark Rinker in court with attorney John M. O'Boyle.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jury trial set for March 10 and 11th.  Discussions have been ongoing.  Parties want to go to a mediator.  Trial date remains on the calendar.  Court encourages parties to continue to negociate.  Court will draft jury instructions.  State requests special jury instructions.   Charge amendment must be done by motion.  Court will consider whether the jury could find on a lesser amount with a lesser penalty.  Information in the file is from May 27, 2014.  Witness Lists by State filed last week.  State names possible 3 rebuttal witnesses.  OBoyle has no discovery re: John Peterson.  State:  no reports available yet.  Court: supplement any discovery in a timely matter.  Defense witnesses: DD - OBoyle will provide witness list by the end of next week.  State: there may be witnesses who will appear by phone.  OBoyle will discuss with his client by the end of this week.  All evidence has been exchanged.  OBoyle questions bank records from 2 institutions.  State to provide names of custodians.  State to end on first day or by 10:30 am on second day.  State responds. Admit exhibits immediately and premark to expediate.  Court will not send documents into the jury room.  State asks about highlighting and using overhead on exhibits.  Court responds re: cut and pasting of paragraphs.  OBoyle - R J, witness of State - can be reduced to motion in limine.  Court: other acts does not come in.  Court: proper foundation must be made before def's credibility can be addressed.  Attys to be here at 8:30 - trial to start at 9:00.
filed by Rory OSullivan

1:59  Defendant Steven Mark Rinker in court with attorney John M O'Boyle.  Rory E O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Information is filed with the court. Copy is given to the defendant. Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights   DEF PLEADS NOT GUILTY to all counts. Court receives the not guilty plea. If the motion hearing is non-evident. the defendant may appear by phone. Speedy trial request is reserved at this time.  Motion hearing scheduled for July 22, 2014 at 10:30 am.
